00019 #include "messaging.h"
00020 #include <stdarg.h>
00021 
00030 int Messaging::sendmessage(SWInetSocket *socket, int type, unsigned int source, unsigned int len, char* content)
00031 {
00032         SWBaseSocket::SWBaseError error;
00033         header_t head;
00034         head.command=type;
00035         head.source=source;
00036         head.size=len;
00037         
00038         unsigned int hlen=0;
00039         
00040         while (hlen<sizeof(header_t))
00041         {
00042                 int sendnum=socket->send(((char*)&head)+hlen, sizeof(header_t)-hlen, &error);
00043                 if (sendnum<0 || error!=SWBaseSocket::ok) 
00044                 {
00045                         return -1;
00046                 }
00047                 hlen+=sendnum;
00048         }
00049         
00050         if (len>0) 
00051         {
00052                 int rlen=0;
00053                 while (rlen<(int)head.size)
00054                 {
00055                         int sendnum=socket->send(content+rlen, head.size-rlen, &error);
00056                         if (sendnum<0 || error!=SWBaseSocket::ok) 
00057                         {
00058                                 return -1;
00059                         }
00060                         rlen+=sendnum;
00061                 }
00062         }
00063         return 0;
00064 }
00065 
00076 int Messaging::receivemessage(SWInetSocket *socket, int *type, unsigned int *source, unsigned int *wrotelen, char* content, unsigned int bufferlen)
00077 {
00078         SWBaseSocket::SWBaseError error;
00079         header_t head;
00080         unsigned int hlen=0;
00081         while (hlen<sizeof(header_t))
00082         {
00083                 int recvnum=socket->recv(((char*)&head)+hlen, sizeof(header_t)-hlen,&error);
00084                 if (recvnum<=0 || error!=SWBaseSocket::ok)
00085                 {
00086                         return -1;
00087                 }
00088                 hlen+=recvnum;
00089         }
00090         if (head.size<=bufferlen)
00091         {
00092                 int rlen=0;
00093                 while (rlen<(int)head.size)
00094                 {
00095                         int recvnum=socket->recv(content+rlen, head.size-rlen, &error);
00096                         if (recvnum<=0 || error!=SWBaseSocket::ok)
00097                         {
00098                                 *wrotelen=rlen;
00099                                 return -1;
00100                         }
00101                         rlen+=recvnum;
00102                 }
00103         } else return -2;
00104         *type=head.command;
00105         *source=head.source;
00106         *wrotelen=head.size;
00107         return 0;
00108 }

00110 int loglevel=1;
00111 
00112 extern "C" {
00113 
00114 void logmsgf(int level, const char* format, ...)
00115 {
00116         if (level<loglevel) return;
00117         time_t lotime=time(NULL);
00118         char timestr[50];
00119 #ifdef __WIN32__
00120         ctime_s(timestr, 50, &lotime);
00121 #else
00122         ctime_r(&lotime, timestr);
00123 #endif
00124         timestr[strlen(timestr)-1]=0;
00125         printf("%s: ", timestr);
00126         va_list args;
00127         va_start(args, format);
00128         vprintf(format, args);
00129         va_end(args);
00130         printf("\n");
00131         fflush(stdout);
00132 }
00133 
00134 }       //      extern "C"
